total_words.note: Within 11 words of target, well above minimum

examples: METR study - AI tools slow experienced developers by 19% (randomized controlled trial)
37signals/Basecamp - 20+ years profitable with deliberate tool minimalism
DORA 2024 report - AI adoption correlated with decreased delivery throughput
Shopify - 322,000 hours of meetings eliminated, 25% more projects completed
Gloria Mark (UC Irvine) - attention spans shrunk from 2.5 min to 47 seconds
Microsoft telemetry - 275 interruptions per day for knowledge workers
Stack Overflow 2025 survey - 49,000 devs say autonomy is #1 satisfaction driver
Spotify squad model - organic tool adoption through autonomy, not mandates
SaaS audit case - founder found $32,736 in unused tool subscriptions
GitHub Copilot - $400M revenue but experienced devs slower per METR
CI/CD adoption data - elite teams deploy 208x more frequently
McKinsey DX programs - 10-20% measurable productivity gains

prose_ratio.note: 100% prose, zero bullet points in the article

editorial_review.thesis_clarity: STRONG - thesis stated in section 1 and reinforced throughout: tool sprawl creates invisible tax; subtraction beats addition
editorial_review.counterarguments_addressed: YES - dedicated section steel-mans CI/CD, version control, and infrastructure tools as genuine force multipliers; draws clear line between infrastructure and coordination tools
editorial_review.narrative_flow: STRONG - hook (contrast fast/slow teams) -> thesis (hidden tool tax) -> analysis (incentive structures) -> counterpoint (real tool wins) -> action (subtract framework)
editorial_review.voice: Opinionated and direct with specific data points; second person throughout; conference-talk energy without academic hedging
editorial_review.header_style: PASS - conversational, no colons, 4-7 words each
